summary.long: Proverbs is a book of the Old Testament.

verses.text: The Proverbs of Solomon the son of David, king of Israel:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: to know wisdom and instruction; to perceive the words of understanding;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: to receive the instruction of wisdom, justice, judgment, and equity;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: to give subtlety to the simple, and to the young man knowledge and discretion.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A wise man will hear and will increase learning, and a man of understanding shall attain unto wise counsel
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: to understand a proverb and the interpretation, the words of the wise and their dark sayings.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The fear of the Lord is the beginning of knowledge, but fools despise wisdom and instruction.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: My son, hear the instruction of thy father, and forsake not the law of thy mother;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for they shall be an ornament of grace unto thy head, and chains about thy neck.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: My son, if sinners entice thee, consent thou not.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If they say, “Come with us; let us lie in wait for blood, let us lurk privily for the innocent without cause;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: let us swallow them up alive as the grave, and whole, as those that go down to the pit;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: we shall find much precious substance, we shall fill our houses with spoil;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: cast in thy lot among us, let us all have one purse”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: my son, walk not thou in the way with them; restrain thy foot from their path;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for their feet run to evil and make haste to shed blood.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Surely in vain the net is spread in the sight of any bird!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they lie in wait for their own blood; they lurk privily for their own lives.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So are the ways of every one that is greedy for gain, which taketh away the life of the owners thereof.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Wisdom crieth without; she uttereth her voice in the streets.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: She crieth in the chief places of concourse, in the openings of the gates; in the city she uttereth her words, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “How long, ye simple ones, will ye love to be simple, and the scorners delight in their scorning, and fools hate knowledge?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Turn you at my reproof: Behold, I will pour out my spirit unto you; I will make known my words unto you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Because I have called and ye refused, I have stretched out my hand and no man heeded,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but ye have set at nought all my counsel and would have none of my reproof,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I also will laugh at your calamity; I will mock when your fear cometh,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: when your fear cometh as desolation, and your destruction cometh as a whirlwind, when distress and anguish cometh upon you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then shall they call upon me, but I will not answer; they shall seek me early, but they shall not find me,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: because they hated knowledge, and did not choose the fear of the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They would have none of my counsel, and they despised all my reproof:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: therefore shall they eat of the fruit of their own ways, and be filled with their own devices.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the turning away of the simple shall slay them, and the prosperity of fools shall destroy them;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but whoso hearkeneth unto me shall dwell safely, and shall have quiet from fear of evil.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: My son, if thou wilt receive my words and hide my commandments within thee,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: so that thou incline thine ear unto wisdom and apply thine heart to understanding;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: yea, if thou criest after knowledge, and liftest up thy voice for understanding;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: if thou seekest her as silver and searchest for her as for hidden treasure,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: then shalt thou understand the fear of the Lord, and find the knowledge of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the Lord giveth wisdom; out of His mouth cometh knowledge and understanding.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He layeth up sound wisdom for the righteous; He is a buckler to them that walk uprightly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He keepeth the paths of judgment, and preserveth the way of His saints.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then shalt thou understand righteousness and judgment and equity, yea, every good path.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When wisdom entereth into thine heart, and knowledge is pleasant unto thy soul,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: discretion shall preserve thee, and understanding shall keep thee,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: to deliver thee from the way of the evil man, from men that speaketh froward things,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: who leave the paths of uprightness to walk in the ways of darkness,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: who rejoice to do evil and delight in the frowardness of the wicked,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: whose ways are crooked and who are froward in their paths.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Wisdom will deliver thee from the strange woman, even from the stranger, who flattereth with her words,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: who forsaketh the guide of her youth, and forgetteth the covenant of her God;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for her house inclineth unto death, and her paths unto the dead.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: None that go unto her return again, neither take they hold of the paths of life.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thus thou mayest walk in the way of good men, and keep to the paths of the righteous.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the upright shall dwell in the land, and the perfect shall remain in it;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but the wicked shall be cut off from the earth, and the transgressors shall be rooted out of it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: My son, forget not my law, but let thine heart keep my commandments;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for length of days and long life and peace shall they add to thee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Let not mercy and truth forsake thee; bind them about thy neck, write them upon the tablet of thine heart.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So shalt thou find favor and good understanding in the sight of God and man.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Trust in the Lord with all thine heart, and lean not unto thine own understanding;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: in all thy ways acknowledge Him, and He shall direct thy paths.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Be not wise in thine own eyes; fear the Lord and depart from evil.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It shall be health to thy flesh and marrow to thy bones.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Honor the Lord with thy substance and with the firstfruits of all thine increase:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: so shall thy barns be filled with plenty, and thy presses shall burst out with new wine.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: My son, despise not the chastening of the Lord, neither be weary of His correction;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for whom the Lord loveth, He correcteth, even as a father the son in whom he delighteth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Happy is the man that findeth wisdom and the man that getteth understanding;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for the merchandising of it is better than the merchandising of silver, and the gain thereof than fine gold.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: She is more precious than rubies, and all the things thou canst desire are not to be compared to her.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Length of days is in her right hand, and in her left hand riches and honor.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Her ways are ways of pleasantness, and all her paths are peace.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: She is a tree of life to them that lay hold upon her, and happy is everyone that retaineth her.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord by wisdom hath founded the earth; by understanding hath He established the heavens;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: by His knowledge the depths are broken up, and the clouds drop down the dew.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: My son, let not these depart from thine eyes: keep sound wisdom and discretion;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: so shall they be life unto thy soul, and grace around thy neck.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then shalt thou walk in thy way safely, and thy foot shall not stumble;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: when thou liest down, thou shalt not be afraid; yea, thou shalt lie down, and thy sleep shall be sweet.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Be not afraid of sudden fear, neither of the desolation of the wicked when it cometh;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for the Lord shall be thy confidence, and shall keep thy foot from being snared.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Withhold not good from them to whom it is due when it is in the power of thine hand to do it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Say not unto thy neighbor, “Go, and come again, and tomorrow I will give,” when thou hast it with thee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Devise not evil against thy neighbor, seeing he dwelleth securely beside thee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Strive not with a man without cause if he has done thee no harm.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Envy thou not the oppressor, and choose none of his ways;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for the froward is an abomination to the Lord, but His secret is with the righteous.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The curse of the Lord is on the house of the wicked, but He blesseth the habitation of the just.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Surely He scorneth the scorners, but He giveth grace unto the lowly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The wise shall inherit glory, but shame shall be the promotion of fools.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Hear, ye children, the instruction of a father, and be attentive to know understanding.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For I give you good doctrine; forsake ye not my law.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For I was my father’s son, tender and only beloved in the sight of my mother.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He taught me also and said unto me, “Let thine heart retain my words: keep my commandments and live.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Get wisdom, get understanding; forget it not, neither decline from the words of my mouth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Forsake her not, and she shall preserve thee; love her, and she shall keep thee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Wisdom is the principal thing, therefore get wisdom; and with all thy getting, get understanding.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Exalt her, and she shall promote thee; she shall bring thee honor when thou dost embrace her.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: She shall give to thine head an ornament of grace; a crown of glory shall she deliver to thee.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Hear, O my son, and receive my sayings, and the years of thy life shall be many.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I have taught thee in the way of wisdom; I have led thee in right paths.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When thou goest, thy steps shall not be straitened; and when thou runnest, thou shalt not stumble.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Hold fast to instruction, let her not go; keep her, for she is thy life.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Enter not into the path of the wicked, and go not in the way of evil men;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: avoid it, pass not by it; turn from it and pass away.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For they sleep not unless they have done mischief, and their sleep is taken away unless they cause some to fall.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For they eat the bread of wickedness, and drink the wine of violence.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the path of the just is as the shining light, that shineth more and more unto the perfect day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The way of the wicked is as darkness; they know not at what they stumble.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: My son, attend to my words; incline thine ear unto my sayings.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Let them not depart from thine eyes, keep them in the midst of thine heart;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for they are life unto those that find them and health to all their flesh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Keep thy heart with all diligence, for out of it are the outflowings of life.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Put away from thee a froward mouth, and perverse lips put far from thee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Let thine eyes look right ahead, and let thine eyelids look straight before thee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Ponder the path of thy feet, and let all thy ways be established.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Turn not to the right hand nor to the left; remove thy foot from evil.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: My son, attend unto my wisdom and bow thine ear to my understanding,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: that thou mayest have regard for discretion, and that thy lips may keep knowledge.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the lips of a strange woman drip as a honeycomb, and her mouth is smoother than oil;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but her end is as bitter as wormwood, sharp as a twoedged sword.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Her feet go down to death; her steps take hold on hell.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Lest thou shouldest ponder the path of life, her ways are wandering, that thou canst not know them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Hear me now therefore, O ye children, and depart not from the words of my mouth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Remove thy way far from her, and come not nigh the door of her house,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: lest thou give thine honor unto others, and thy years unto the cruel,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: lest strangers be filled with thy wealth and thy labors be in the house of a stranger,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and thou mourn at the last when thy flesh and thy body are consumed,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and thou sayest, “How have I hated instruction and my heart despised reproof;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and have not obeyed the voice of my teachers, nor inclined mine ear to them that instructed me!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I was almost in total evil in the midst of the congregation and assembly.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Drink waters out of thine own cistern, and running waters out of thine own well.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Let thy fountains be dispersed abroad, and rivers of waters in the streets.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Let them be only thine own, and not for strangers with thee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Let thy fountain be blessed, and rejoice with the wife of thy youth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Let her be as the loving hind and pleasant roe; let her breasts satisfy thee at all times, and be thou ravished always with her love.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And why wilt thou, my son, be ravished with a strange woman, and embrace the bosom of a stranger?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the ways of man are before the eyes of the Lord, and He pondereth all his doings.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: His own iniquities shall entrap the wicked himself, and he shall be held by the cords of his sins.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He shall die without instruction, and in the greatness of his folly shall he go astray.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: My son, if thou be surety for thy friend, if thou hast struck thy hand with a stranger,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: thou art snared with the words of thy mouth; thou art taken with the words of thy mouth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Do this now, my son, and deliver thyself when thou hast come into the hand of thy friend: Go, humble thyself, so that thou shalt prevail with thy friend.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Give not sleep to thine eyes, nor slumber to thine eyelids.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Deliver thyself as a roe from the hand of the hunter, and as a bird from the hand of the fowler.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Look to the ant, thou sluggard! Consider her ways and be wise,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: which, having no guide, overseer or ruler,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: provideth her meat in the summer and gathereth her food in the harvest.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: How long wilt thou sleep, O sluggard? When wilt thou arise out of thy sleep?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yet a little sleep, a little slumber, a little folding of the hands to sleep”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: so shall thy poverty come as a marauder, and thy want as an armed man.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A vile person, a wicked man walketh with a froward mouth;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: he winketh with his eyes, he speaketh with his feet, he teacheth with his fingers;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: frowardness is in his heart, he deviseth mischief continually, he soweth discord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore shall his calamity come suddenly; suddenly shall he be broken without remedy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These six things doth the Lord hate, yea, seven are an abomination unto Him:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: a proud look, a lying tongue, hands that shed innocent blood,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: a heart that deviseth wicked imaginations, feet that be swift in running to mischief,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: a false witness that speaketh lies, and he that soweth discord among brethren.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: My son, keep thy father’s commandment, and forsake not the law of thy mother.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Bind them continually upon thine heart, and tie them about thy neck.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When thou goest, it shall lead thee; when thou sleepest, it shall keep thee; when thou awakest, it shall talk with thee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the commandment is a lamp, and the law is light; and reproofs of instruction are the way of life
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: to keep thee from the evil woman, from the flattery of the tongue of a strange woman.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Lust not after her beauty in thine heart, neither let her take thee with her eyelids.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For by means of a whorish woman a man is brought down to a piece of bread, and the adulteress will hunt for the precious life.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Can a man take fire to his bosom, and his clothes not be burned?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Can one go upon hot coals, and his feet not be burned?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So he that goeth in to his neighbor’s wife; whosoever toucheth her shall not be innocent.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Men do not despise a thief if he steal to satisfy his soul when he is hungry.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if he be found, he shall restore sevenfold; he shall give all the substance of his house.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But whoso committeth adultery with a woman lacketh understanding; he that doeth it destroyeth his own soul.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A wound and dishonor shall he get, and his reproach shall not be wiped away.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For jealousy is the rage of a man; therefore he will not spare in the day of vengeance;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: he will not consider any ransom; neither will he rest content, though thou givest many gifts.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: My son, keep my words, and lay up my commandments with thee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Keep my commandments and live, and my law as the apple of thine eye.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Bind them upon thy fingers; write them upon the tablet of thine heart.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Say unto wisdom, “Thou art my sister,” and call understanding thy kinswoman,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: that they may keep thee from the strange woman, from the harlot who flattereth with her words.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For at the window of my house I looked through my casement,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and I beheld among the simple ones, I discerned among the youth, a young man void of understanding,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: passing through the street near her corner; and he went the way to her house,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: in the twilight, in the evening, in the black and dark night.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And behold, there met him a woman with the attire of a harlot and subtle of heart.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: (She is loud and stubborn, her feet abide not in her house;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: now is she outside, now in the streets and lieth in wait at every corner.)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So she caught him and kissed him, and with an impudent face said unto him:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “I have peace offerings with me; this day have I paid my vows.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore came I forth to meet thee, diligently seeking thy face, and I have found thee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I have decked my bed with coverings of tapestry, with carved works, with fine linen of Egypt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I have perfumed my bed with myrrh, aloes, and cinnamon.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Come, let us take our fill of love until the morning; let us solace ourselves with love.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the master is not at home; he is gone on a long journey.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He hath taken a bag of money with him, and will come home at the day appointed.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: With her much fair speech she caused him to yield; with the flattering of her lips she forced him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He goeth after her straightway, as an ox goeth to the slaughter, or as a fool to the correction of the stocks,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: until a dart strike through his liver, as a bird hasteneth to the snare and knoweth not that it is for his life.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Hearken unto me now, therefore, O ye children, and attend to the words of my mouth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Let not thine heart decline to her ways; go not astray in her paths.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For she hath cast down many wounded; yea, many strong men have been slain by her.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Her house is the way to hell, leading down to the chambers of death.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Doth not wisdom cry out, and understanding put forth her voice?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: She standeth at the top of high places, by the wayside where the paths meet.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: She crieth at the gates, at the entry of the city, at the coming in at the doors:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Unto you, O men, I call, and my voice is to the sons of man.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: O ye simple, understand wisdom; and ye fools, be ye of an understanding heart.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Hear, for I will speak of excellent things, and the opening of my lips shall be of right things;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for my mouth shall speak truth, and wickedness is an abomination to my lips.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All the words of my mouth are in righteousness; there is nothing froward or perverse in them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They are all plain to him that understandeth, and right to them that find knowledge.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Receive my instruction and not silver, and knowledge rather than choice gold;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for wisdom is better than rubies, and all the things that may be desired are not to be compared to it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “I, wisdom, dwell with prudence, and disclose knowledge of learned thoughts.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The fear of the Lord is to hate evil; pride and arrogance and the evil way and the froward mouth do I hate.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Counsel is mine and sound wisdom; I am understanding, I have strength.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: By me kings reign, and princes decree justice.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: By me princes rule and nobles, even all the judges of the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I love them that love me, and those that seek me early shall find me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Riches and honor are with me, yea, durable riches and righteousness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: My fruit is better than gold, yea, than fine gold, and my revenue than choice silver.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I lead in the way of righteousness, in the midst of the paths of judgment,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: that I may cause those that love me to inherit substance, and I will fill their treasuries.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “The Lord possessed me at the beginning of His way, before His works of old.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I was set up from everlasting, from the beginning, or ever the earth was.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When there were no depths I was brought forth, when there were no fountains abounding with water.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Before the mountains were settled, before the hills was I brought forth,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: while as yet He had not made the earth, nor the fields, nor the first parts of dust of the world.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When He prepared the heavens, I was there; when He set a compass upon the face of the deep,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: when He established the clouds above, when He strengthened the fountains of the deep,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: when He gave to the sea His decree that the waters should not pass His commandment, when He appointed the foundations of the earth”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: then I was by Him, as one brought up with Him, and I was daily His delight, rejoicing always before Him,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: rejoicing in the habitable part of His earth; and my delights were with the sons of men.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Now therefore hearken unto me, O ye children, for blessed are they that keep my ways.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Hear instruction and be wise, and refuse it not.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Blessed is the man that heareth me, watching daily at my gates, waiting at the posts of my doors.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For whoso findeth me findeth life, and shall obtain the favor of the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he that sinneth against me wrongeth his own soul; all they that hate me love death.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Wisdom hath built her house; she hath hewn out her seven pillars.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: She hath killed her beasts, she hath mingled her wine, she hath also furnished her table.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: She hath sent forth her maidens, she crieth from the highest places of the city:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Whoso is simple, let him turn in hither!” As for him that wanteth understanding, she saith to him:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Come, eat of my bread and drink of the wine which I have mixed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Forsake the foolish and live, and go in the way of understanding.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He that reproveth a scorner getteth for himself shame, and he that rebuketh a wicked man getteth himself a reproach.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Reprove not a scorner, lest he hate thee; rebuke a wise man, and he will love thee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Give instruction to a wise man, and he will be yet wiser; teach a just man, and he will increase in learning.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The fear of the Lord is the beginning of wisdom, and the knowledge of the holy is understanding.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For by me thy days shall be multiplied, and the years of thy life shall be increased.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If thou be wise, thou shalt be wise for thyself; but if thou be a scorner, thou alone shall bear it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A foolish woman is clamorous; she is simple and knoweth nothing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For she sitteth at the door of her house on a seat in the high places of the city,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: to call passers by who go rightly on their ways:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Whoso is simple, let him turn in hither.” And as for him that lacketh understanding, she saith to him,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Stolen waters are sweet, and bread eaten in secret is pleasant.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he knoweth not that the dead are there, and that her guests are in the depths of hell. The proverbs of Solomon:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A wise son maketh a glad father, but a foolish son is the heaviness of his mother.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Treasures from wickedness profit nothing, but righteousness delivereth from death.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord will not suffer the soul of the righteous to famish, but He casteth away the substance of the wicked.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He becometh poor that dealeth with a slack hand, but the hand of the diligent maketh rich.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He that gathereth in summer is a wise son, but he that sleepeth in harvest is a son that causeth shame.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Blessings are upon the head of the just, but violence covereth the mouth of the wicked.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The memory of the just is blessed, but the name of the wicked shall rot.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The wise in heart will receive commandments, but a prating fool shall fall.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He that walketh uprightly walketh surely, but he that perverteth his ways shall be made known.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He that winketh with the eye causeth sorrow, but a prating fool shall fall.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The mouth of a righteous man is a well of life, but violence covereth the mouth of the wicked.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Hatred stirreth up strifes, but love covereth all sins.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On the lips of him that hath understanding wisdom is found, but a rod is for the back of him that is void of understanding.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Wise men lay up knowledge, but the mouth of the foolish is near destruction.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The rich man’s wealth is his strong city; the destruction of the poor is their poverty.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The labor of the righteous tendeth to life, the fruit of the wicked to sin.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He that keepeth instruction is in the way of life, but he that refuseth reproof erreth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He that hideth hatred with lying lips, and he that uttereth slander, is a fool.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In the multitude of words there lacketh not sin, but he that restraineth his lips is wise.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The tongue of the just is as choice silver; the heart of the wicked is of little worth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The lips of the righteous feed many, but fools die for want of wisdom.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The blessings of the Lord maketh rich, and He addeth no sorrow with it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It is as sport to a fool to do mischief, but a man of understanding hath wisdom.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The fear of the wicked, it shall come upon him; but the desire of the righteous shall be granted.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As the whirlwind passeth, so is the wicked no more; but the righteous is as an everlasting foundation.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As vinegar to the teeth and as smoke to the eyes, so is the sluggard to them that send him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The fear of the Lord prolongeth days, but the years of the wicked shall be shortened.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The hope of the righteous shall be gladness, but the expectation of the wicked shall perish.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The way of the Lord is strength to the upright, but destruction shall come to the workers of iniquity.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The righteous shall never be removed, but the wicked shall not inhabit the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The mouth of the just bringeth forth wisdom, but the froward tongue shall be cut out.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The lips of the righteous know what is acceptable, but the mouth of the wicked speaketh frowardness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A false balance is an abomination to the Lord, but a just weight is His delight.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When pride cometh, then cometh shame, but with the lowly is wisdom.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The integrity of the upright shall guide them, but the perverseness of transgressors shall destroy them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Riches profit not in the day of wrath, but righteousness delivereth from death.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The righteousness of the perfect shall direct his way, but the wicked shall fall by his own wickedness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The righteousness of the upright shall deliver them, but the transgressors shall be taken in their own wickedness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When a wicked man dieth, his expectation shall perish; and the hope of unjust men perisheth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The righteous is delivered out of trouble, and the wicked cometh in his stead.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A hypocrite with his mouth destroyeth his neighbor, but through knowledge shall the just be delivered.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When it goeth well with the righteous, the city rejoiceth; and when the wicked perish, there is shouting.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: By the blessing of the upright the city is exalted, but it is overthrown by the mouth of the wicked.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He that is void of wisdom despiseth his neighbor, but a man of understanding holdeth his peace.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A talebearer revealeth secrets, but he that is of a faithful spirit concealeth the matter.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Where no counsel is, the people fall; but in the multitude of counselors there is safety.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He that is surety for a stranger shall smart for it, and he that hateth suretyship is sure.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A gracious woman retaineth honor, and strong men retain riches.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The merciful man doeth good to his own soul, but he that is cruel troubleth his own flesh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The wicked worketh a deceitful work, but to him that soweth righteousness shall be a sure reward.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As righteousness tendeth to life, so he that pursueth evil pursueth it to his own death.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They that are of a froward heart are an abomination to the Lord, but such as are upright in their ways are His delight.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Though they join hand in hand, the wicked shall not go unpunished; but the seed of the righteous shall be delivered.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As is a jewel of gold in a swine’s snout, so also is a fair woman who is without discretion.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The desire of the righteous is only good, but the expectation of the wicked is wrath.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There is one that scattereth and yet prospereth; and there is another that withholdeth more than is meet, but it tendeth to poverty.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The liberal soul shall prosper, and he that watereth shall be watered also himself.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He that withholdeth corn, the people shall curse him; but blessings shall be upon the head of him that selleth it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He that diligently seeketh good procureth favor; but he that seeketh mischief, it shall come unto him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He that trusteth in his riches shall fall, but the righteous shall flourish as a branch.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He that troubleth his own house shall inherit the wind, and the fool shall be servant to the wise of heart.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The fruit of the righteous is a tree of life, and he that winneth souls is wise.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Behold, the righteous shall be recompensed on earth; much more shall the wicked and the sinner!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Whoso loveth instruction loveth knowledge, but he that hateth reproof is brutish.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A good man obtaineth favor of the Lord, but a man of wicked devices will He condemn.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A man shall not be established by wickedness, but the root of the righteous shall not be moved.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A virtuous woman is a crown to her husband, but she that causeth shame is rottenness in his bones.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The thoughts of the righteous are right, but the counsels of the wicked are deceit.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The counsels of the wicked are to lie in wait for blood, but the mouths of the upright shall deliver them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The wicked are overthrown and are no more, but the house of the righteous shall stand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A man shall be commended according to his wisdom, but he that is of a perverse heart shall be despised.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He that is lowly and hath a servant is better off than he that honoreth himself and lacketh bread.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A righteous man hath regard for the life of his beast, but the tender mercies of the wicked are cruel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He that tilleth his land shall be satisfied with bread, but he that followeth vain persons is void of understanding.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The wicked desireth the net of evil men, but the root of the righteous yieldeth fruit.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The wicked is snared by the transgression of his lips, but the just shall come out of trouble.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A man shall be satisfied with good by the fruit of his mouth, and the recompense of a man’s hands shall be rendered unto him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The way of a fool is right in his own eyes, but he that hearkeneth unto counsel is wise.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A fool’s wrath is known at once, but a prudent man covereth shame.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He that speaketh truth showeth forth righteousness, but a false witness, deceit.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There is he that speaketh like the piercings of a sword, but the tongue of the wise is healing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The lips of truth shall be established for ever, but a lying tongue is but for a moment.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Deceit is in the heart of them that imagine evil, but to the counselors of peace there is joy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There shall no evil happen to the just, but the wicked shall be filled with troubles.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Lying lips are an abomination to the Lord, but they that deal truly are His delight.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A prudent man concealeth knowledge, but the heart of fools proclaimeth foolishness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The hand of the diligent shall exercise rule, but the slothful shall be under tribute.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Heaviness in the heart of man maketh it stoop, but a good word maketh it glad.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The righteous is more excellent than his neighbor, but the way of the wicked seduceth them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The slothful man roasteth not that which he took in hunting, but the substance of a diligent man is precious.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In the way of righteousness is life, and in the pathway thereof there is no death.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A wise son heareth his father’s instruction, but a scorner heareth not rebuke.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A man shall eat good by the fruit of his mouth, but the soul of the transgressor shall eat violence.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He that guardeth his mouth keepeth his life, but he that openeth wide his lips shall meet destruction.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The soul of the sluggard desireth, and hath nothing, but the soul of the diligent shall be made fat.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A righteous man hateth lying, but a wicked man is loathsome, and cometh to shame.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Righteousness keepeth him that is upright in the way, but wickedness overthroweth the sinner.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There is one that maketh himself rich, yet hath nothing; there is one that maketh himself poor, yet hath great riches.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The ransom of a man’s life is his riches, but the poor heareth not rebuke.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The light of the righteous rejoiceth, but the lamp of the wicked shall be put out.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Only by pride cometh contention, but with the welladvised is wisdom.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Wealth gotten by vanity shall be diminished, but he that gathereth by labor shall increase.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Hope deferred maketh the heart sick, but when a desire is fulfilled, it is a tree of life.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Whoso despiseth the Word shall be destroyed, but he that feareth the commandment shall be rewarded.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The law of the wise is a fountain of life, to turn him from the snares of death.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Good understanding giveth favor, but the way of transgressors is hard.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Every prudent man dealeth with knowledge, but a fool layeth open his folly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A wicked messenger falleth into mischief, but a faithful ambassador is health.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Poverty and shame shall be with him that refuseth instruction, but he that hath regard for reproof shall be honored.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The desire accomplished is sweet to the soul, but it is an abomination to fools to depart from evil.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He that walketh with wise men shall be wise, but a companion of fools shall be destroyed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Evil pursueth sinners, but to the righteous, good shall be repaid.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A good man leaveth an inheritance to his children’s children, and the wealth of the sinner is laid up for the just.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Much food is in the tillage of the poor, but there is that which is destroyed for want of judgment.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He that spareth his rod hateth his son, but he that loveth him chasteneth him in good season.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The righteous eateth to the satisfying of his soul, but the belly of the wicked shall want.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Every wise woman buildeth her house, but the foolish plucketh it down with her hands.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He that walketh in his uprightness feareth the Lord, but he that is perverse in his ways despiseth Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The mouth of the foolish is a rod of pride, but the lips of the wise shall preserve him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Where no oxen are, the crib is clean, but much increase comes by the strength of the ox.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A faithful witness will not lie, but a false witness will utter lies.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A scorner seeketh wisdom and findeth it not, but knowledge is easy unto him that understandeth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Go from the presence of a foolish man when thou perceivest not in him the lips of knowledge.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The wisdom of the prudent is to understand his way, but the folly of fools is to be deceived.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Fools mock at sin, but among the righteous there is favor.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The heart knoweth his own bitterness, and a stranger doth not intermeddle with his joy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The house of the wicked shall be overthrown, but the tabernacle of the upright shall flourish.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There is a way which seemeth right unto a man, but the end thereof are the ways of death.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Even in laughter the heart is sorrowful, and the end of that mirth is heaviness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The backslider in heart shall be filled with his own ways, and a good man shall be satisfied from himself.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The simple believeth every word, but the prudent man looketh well to his going.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A wise man feareth, and departeth from evil, but the fool rageth and is confident.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He that is soon angry dealeth foolishly, and a man of wicked devices is hated.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The simple inherit folly, but the prudent are crowned with knowledge.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The evil bow before the good, the wicked at the gates of the righteous.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The poor is hated even by his own neighbor, but the rich hath many friends.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He that despiseth his neighbor sinneth, but he that hath mercy on the poor, happy is he.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Do they not err that devise evil? But mercy and truth shall be to them that devise good.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In all labor there is profit, but the talk of the lips tendeth only to penury.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The crown of the wise is their riches, but the foolishness of fools is folly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A truthful witness delivereth souls, but a deceitful witness speaketh lies.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In the fear of the Lord is strong confidence, and His children shall have a place of refuge.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The fear of the Lord is a fountain of life to depart from the snares of death.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In a multitude of people is the honor of the king, but the lack of people is the destruction of the prince.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He that is slow to wrath is of great understanding, but he that is hasty of spirit exalteth folly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A sound heart is the life of the flesh, but envy is the rottenness of the bones.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He that oppresseth the poor reproacheth his Maker, but he that honoreth Him hath mercy on the poor.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The wicked is driven away in his wickedness, but the righteous hath hope in his death.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Wisdom resteth in the heart of him that hath understanding, but that which is innermost in fools is made known.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Righteousness exalteth a nation, but sin is a reproach to any people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The king’s favor is toward a wise servant, but his wrath is against him that causeth shame.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A soft answer turneth away wrath, but grievous words stir up anger.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The tongue of the wise useth knowledge aright, but the mouth of fools poureth out foolishness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The eyes of the Lord are in every place, beholding the evil and the good.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A wholesome tongue is a tree of life, but perverseness therein is a breach in the spirit.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A fool despiseth his father’s instruction, but he that heedeth reproof is prudent.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In the house of the righteous is much treasure, but the revenues of the wicked bring trouble.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The lips of the wise disperse knowledge, but the heart of the foolish doeth not so.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sacrifice of the wicked is an abomination to the Lord, but the prayer of the upright is His delight.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The way of the wicked is an abomination unto the Lord, but He loveth him that followeth after righteousness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Correction is grievous unto him that forsaketh the way, and he that hateth reproof shall die.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Hell and destruction are the concern of the Lord; how much more then, the hearts of the children of men?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A scorner loveth not one that reproveth him, neither will he go unto the wise.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A merry heart maketh a cheerful countenance, but by sorrow of the heart the spirit is broken.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The heart of him that hath understanding seeketh knowledge, but the mouth of fools feedeth on foolishness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All the days of the afflicted are evil, but he that is of a merry heart hath a continual feast.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Better is little with the fear of the Lord, than great treasure and trouble therewith.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Better is a dinner of herbs where love is, than a fattened ox and hatred therewith.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A wrathful man stirreth up strife, but he that is slow to anger appeaseth strife.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The way of a slothful man is as a hedge of thorns, but the path of the righteous is made a plain.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A wise son maketh a glad father, but a foolish man despiseth his mother.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Folly is joy to him that is destitute of wisdom, but the man of understanding walketh uprightly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Without counsel purposes are disappointed, but in the multitude of counselors they are established.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A man hath joy by the answer of his mouth, and a word spoken in due season — how good it is!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The path of life is upward for the wise, that he may depart from hell beneath.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord will destroy the house of the proud, but He will establish the border of the widow.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The thoughts of the wicked are an abomination to the Lord, but the words of the pure are pleasant words.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He that is greedy for gain troubleth his own house, but he that hateth bribes shall live.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The heart of the righteous studieth how to answer, but the mouth of the wicked poureth out evil things.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord is far from the wicked, but He heareth the prayer of the righteous.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The light of the eyes maketh the heart rejoice, and a good report maketh the bones fat.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The ear that heareth the reproof of life abideth among the wise.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He that refuseth instruction despiseth his own soul, but he that heareth reproof getteth understanding.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The fear of the Lord is the instruction of wisdom, and before honor is humility.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The preparation of the heart in man, and the answer of the tongue, is from the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All the ways of a man are clean in his own eyes, but the Lord weigheth his spirit.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Commit thy works unto the Lord, and thy thoughts shall be established.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord hath made all things for Himself, yea, even the wicked for the day of evil.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Everyone that is proud in heart is an abomination to the Lord; though they join hands, they shall not go unpunished.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: By mercy and truth iniquity is purged, and by the fear of the Lord men depart from evil.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When man’s ways please the Lord, He maketh even his enemies to be at peace with him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Better is a little with righteousness, than great revenues without righteousness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A man’s heart deviseth his way, but the Lord directeth his steps.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A divine sentence is in the lips of the king; his mouth transgresseth not in judgment.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A just weight and balance are the Lord’S; all the weights of the bag are His work.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It is an abomination for kings to commit wickedness, for the throne is established by righteousness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Righteous lips are the delight of kings, and they love him that speaketh right.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The wrath of a king is as a messenger of death, but a wise man will pacify it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In the light of the king’s countenance there is life, and his favor is as a cloud of latter rain.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: How much better it is to get wisdom than gold! And to get understanding is rather to be chosen than silver!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The highway of the upright is to depart from evil; he that keepeth his way preserveth his soul.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Pride goeth before destruction, and a haughty spirit before a fall.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Better it is to be of a humble spirit with the lowly, than to divide the spoil with the proud.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He that handleth a matter wisely shall find good, and whoso trusteth in the Lord, happy is he.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The wise in heart shall be called prudent, and sweetness of the lips increaseth learning.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Understanding is a wellspring of life unto him that hath it, but the instruction of fools is folly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The heart of the wise teacheth his mouth, and addeth learning to his lips.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Pleasant words are as a honeycomb: sweet to the soul and health to the bones.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There are ways which seemeth right unto a man, but the end thereof are the ways of death.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He that laboreth, laboreth for himself, for his mouth craveth it of him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A froward man diggeth up evil, and on his lips there is a burning fire.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A froward man soweth strife, and a whisperer separateth closest friends.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A violent man enticeth his neighbor and leadeth him into the way that is not good.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He shutteth his eyes to devise froward things; moving his lips he bringeth evil to pass.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The hoary head is a crown of glory, if it be found in the way of righteousness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He that is slow to anger is better than the mighty, and he that ruleth his spirit than he that taketh a city.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The lot is cast into the lap, but the whole disposing thereof is of the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Better is a dry morsel and quietness therewith than a house full of feasting with strife.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A wise servant shall have rule over a son that causeth shame, and shall have part of the inheritance among the brethren.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The refining pot is for silver and the furnace for gold, but the Lord trieth the hearts.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A wicked doer giveth heed to false lips, and a liar giveth ear to a wicked tongue.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Whoso mocketh the poor reproacheth his Maker, and he that is glad at calamities shall not go unpunished.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Children’s children are the crown of old men, and the glory of children are their fathers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Excellent speech becometh not a fool, much less do lying lips a prince.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A gift is as a precious stone in the eyes of him that hath it; whithersoever it turneth, it prospereth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He that covereth a transgression seeketh love, but he that repeateth a matter separateth good friends.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A reproof entereth deeper into a wise man than a hundred stripes into a fool.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: An evil man seeketh only rebellion; therefore a cruel messenger shall be sent against him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Let a man meet a bear robbed of her whelps, rather than a fool in his folly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Whoso returneth evil for good, evil shall not depart from his house.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The beginning of strife is like the letting out of water: therefore break off contention before it is meddled with.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He that justifieth the wicked and he that condemneth the just, both alike are an abomination to the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Why should there be in the hands of a fool the price to purchase wisdom, seeing he hath no heart to acquire it?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A friend is loving at all times, and a brother is born for adversity.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A man void of understanding shaketh hands in pledge, and becometh surety in the presence of his friend.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He loveth transgression that loveth strife, and he that exalteth his gate seeketh destruction.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He that hath a froward heart findeth no good, and he that hath a perverse tongue falleth into iniquity.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He that begetteth a fool doeth so to his sorrow, and the father of a fool hath no joy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A merry heart doeth good like a medicine, but a broken spirit drieth the bones.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A wicked man taketh a bribe out of the bosom to pervert the ways of judgment.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Wisdom is before him that hath understanding, but the eyes of a fool are on the ends of the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A foolish son is a grief to his father, and bitterness to her that bore him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Also to punish the just is not good, nor to strike princes for their equity.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He that hath knowledge spareth his words, and a man of understanding is of excelling spirit.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Even a fool, when he holdeth his peace, is counted wise, and he that shutteth his lips is esteemed a man of understanding.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Through desire a man, having separated himself, seeketh and intermeddleth with all wisdom.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A fool hath no delight in understanding, unless his heart may discover itself.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the wicked cometh, then cometh also contempt; and with ignominy, reproach.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The words of a man’s mouth are as deep waters, and the wellspring of wisdom as a flowing brook.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It is not good to accept the person of the wicked, to overthrow the righteous in judgment.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A fool’s lips enter into contention, and his mouth calleth for blows.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A fool’s mouth is his destruction, and his lips are the snare of his soul.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The words of a talebearer are as wounds, and they go down into the innermost parts of the belly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He that is slothful in his work is a brother to him that is a great waster.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The name of the Lord is a strong tower; the righteous runneth into it and is safe.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The rich man’s wealth is his stronghold, and as a high wall in his own conceit.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Before destruction the heart of a man is haughty, and before honor is humility.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He that answereth a matter before he heareth it, it is folly and shame unto him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The spirit of a man will sustain his infirmity; but a wounded spirit, who can bear?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The heart of the prudent getteth knowledge, and the ear of the wise seeketh knowledge.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A man’s gift maketh room for him and bringeth him before great men.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He that first states his own cause seemeth just, but then his neighbor cometh and searcheth him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Casting lots causeth contentions to cease, and parteth the strife of the mighty.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: An offended brother is harder to be won back than a stronghold city, and his contentions are like the bars of a castle.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A man’s belly shall be satisfied with the fruit of his mouth; and with the harvest of his lips shall he be filled.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Death and life are in the power of the tongue, and they that love it shall eat the fruit thereof.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Whosoever findeth a wife findeth a good thing and obtaineth the favor of the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The poor useth entreaties, but the rich answereth roughly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A man that hath friends must show himself friendly, and there is a friend that sticketh closer than a brother.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Better is the poor that walketh in his integrity, than he that is perverse in his lips and is a fool.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Even as a soul without knowledge is not good, so he that maketh haste with his feet sinneth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The foolishness of man perverteth his way, and his heart fretteth against the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Wealth maketh many friends, but the poor is separated from his neighbor.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A false witness shall not be unpunished, and he that speaketh lies shall not escape.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Many will entreat the favor of the prince, and every man is a friend to him that giveth gifts.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All the brethren of the poor hate him—how much more do his friends go far from him! He pursueth them with words, yet they are not forthcoming to him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He that getteth wisdom loveth his own soul; he that keepeth understanding shall find good.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A false witness shall not be unpunished, and he that speaketh lies shall perish.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Delight is not seemly for a fool, much less for a servant to have rule over princes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The discretion of a man deferreth his anger, and it is his glory to pass over a transgression.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The king’s wrath is as the roaring of a lion, but his favor is as dew upon the grass.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A foolish son is the calamity of his father, and the contentions of a wife are a continual dripping.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: House and riches are the inheritance from fathers, and a prudent wife is from the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Slothfulness casteth into a deep sleep, and an idle soul shall suffer hunger.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He that keepeth the commandment keepeth his own soul, but he that despiseth His ways shall die.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He that hath pity upon the poor lendeth unto the Lord, and that which he hath given, He will repay him again.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Chasten thy son while there is hope, and let not thy soul spare him for his crying.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A man of great wrath shall suffer punishment; for if thou rescue him, yet thou must do it again.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Hear counsel and receive instruction, that thou mayest be wise in thy latter end.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There are many devices in a man’s heart; nevertheless the counsel of the Lord, that shall stand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: What is desired of a man is his kindness, and a poor man is better than a liar.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The fear of the Lord tendeth to life, and he that hath it shall abide satisfied; he shall not be visited with evil.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A slothful man hideth his hand in his bosom, and will not so much as bring it to his mouth again.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Smite a scorner, and the simple will beware; reprove one that hath understanding, and he will gain knowledge.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He that afflicteth his father and chaseth away his mother is a son that causeth shame and bringeth reproach.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Cease, my son, to hear the instruction that causeth thee to err from the words of knowledge.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: An ungodly witness scorneth judgment, and the mouth of the wicked devoureth iniquity.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Judgments are prepared for scorners, and stripes for the back of fools.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Wine is a mocker, strong drink is enraging; and whosoever is deceived thereby is not wise.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The wrath of a king is as the roaring of a lion; whoso provoketh him to anger sinneth against his own soul.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It is an honor for a man to cease from strife, but every fool will be meddling.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sluggard will not plow by reason of the cold; therefore shall he beg in harvest and have nothing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Counsel in the heart of man is like deep water, but a man of understanding will draw it out.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Most men will proclaim every one his own goodness; but a faithful man, who can find?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The just man walketh in his integrity; his children are blessed after him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A king that sitteth on the throne of judgment scattereth away all evil with his eyes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Who can say, “I have made my heart clean, I am pure from my sin”?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Differing weights and differing measures—both of them alike are an abomination to the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Even a child is known by his doings, whether his work be pure and whether it be right.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The hearing ear and the seeing eye, the Lord hath made even both of them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Love not sleep lest thou come to poverty; open thine eyes, and thou shalt be satisfied with bread.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “It is nought, it is worthless!” saith the buyer; but when he has gone his way, then he boasteth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There is gold and a multitude of rubies, but the lips of knowledge are a precious jewel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Take his garment that is surety for a stranger; and take a pledge of him for a strange woman.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The bread of deceit is sweet to a man, but afterwards his mouth shall be filled with gravel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Every purpose is established by counsel, but only with good advice make war.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He that goeth about as a talebearer revealeth secrets; therefore meddle not with him that flattereth with his lips.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Whoso curseth his father or his mother, his lamp shall be put out in obscure darkness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: An inheritance may be gotten hastily in the beginning, but the end thereof shall not be blessed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Say thou not, “I will recompense evil”; but wait on the Lord, and He shall save thee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Differing weights are an abomination unto the Lord, and a false balance is not good.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Man’s goings are of the Lord; how then can a man understand his own way?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It is a snare for a man to devour that which is holy, and after vows to make inquiry.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A wise king scattereth the wicked, and driveth the wheel over them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The spirit of man is the candle of the Lord, searching all the inward parts of his being.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Mercy and truth preserve the king, and his throne is upheld by mercy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The glory of young men is their strength, and the beauty of old men is the gray head.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The bruising of a wound cleanseth away evil—so also do stripes the inward parts of the being.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The king’s heart is in the hand of the Lord; as the rivers of water, He turneth it whithersoever He will.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Every way of a man is right in his own eyes, but the Lord pondereth the hearts.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: To do justice and judgment is more acceptable to the Lord than sacrifice.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A haughty look and a proud heart, and the plowing of the wicked, are sin.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The thoughts of the diligent tend only to plenteousness, but of everyone that is hasty, only to want.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The getting of treasures by a lying tongue is a vanity which is tossed to and fro by them that seek death.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The robberies of the wicked shall destroy them, because they refuse to do judgment.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The way of man is froward and strange, but as for the pure, his work is right.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It is better to dwell in a corner of the housetop than with a brawling woman in a large house.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The soul of the wicked desireth evil; his neighbor findeth no favor in his eyes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the scorner is punished, the simple is made wise; and when the wise is instructed, he receiveth knowledge.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The righteous man wisely considereth the house of the wicked, how God overthroweth the wicked for their wickedness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Whoso stoppeth his ears at the cry of the poor, he also shall himself cry, but shall not be heard.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A gift in secret pacifieth anger, and a bribe in the bosom, strong wrath.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It is a joy to the just to do judgment, but destruction shall come to the workers of iniquity.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The man that wandereth out of the way of understanding shall remain in the congregation of the dead.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He that loveth pleasure shall be a poor man; he that loveth wine and oil shall not be rich.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The wicked shall be a ransom for the righteous, and the transgressor for the upright.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It is better to dwell in the wilderness than with a contentious and angry woman.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There is treasure to be desired and oil in the dwelling of the wise, but a foolish man spendeth it up.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He that followeth after righteousness and mercy findeth life, righteousness and honor.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A wise man scaleth the city of the mighty, and casteth down the strength of their confidence.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Whoso guardeth his mouth and his tongue keepeth his soul from troubles.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Proud and haughty scorner is his name, who dealeth in proud wrath.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The desire of the slothful killeth him, for his hands refuse to labor;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: he coveteth greedily all the day long, but the righteous giveth and spareth not.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sacrifice of the wicked is an abomination; how much more so when he bringeth it with a wicked mind!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A false witness shall perish, but the man that heareth speaketh constantly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A wicked man hardeneth his face, but as for the upright, he considereth his ways.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There is no wisdom, nor understanding, nor counsel against the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The horse is prepared for the day of battle, but safety is from the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A good name is rather to be chosen than great riches, and loving favor rather than silver and gold.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The rich and poor meet together; the Lord is the maker of them all.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A prudent man foreseeth the evil and hideth himself, but the simple pass by and are punished.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: With humility and the fear of the Lord come riches and honor and life.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thorns and snares are in the path of the froward; he that doth keep his soul shall stay far from them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Train up a child in the way he should go, and when he is old he will not depart from it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The rich ruleth over the poor, and the borrower is servant to the lender.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He that soweth iniquity shall reap vanity, and the rod of his anger shall fail.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He that hath a bountiful eye shall be blessed, for he giveth of his bread to the poor.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Cast out the scorner, and contention shall go away; yea, strife and reproach shall cease.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He that loveth pureness of heart: for the grace of his lips the king shall be his friend.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The eyes of the Lord preserve knowledge, and He overthroweth the words of the transgressor.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The slothful man saith, “There is a lion without! I shall be slain in the streets!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The mouth of a strange woman is a deep pit; he that is abhorred by the Lord shall fall therein.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Foolishness is bound into the heart of a child, but the rod of correction shall drive it far from him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He that oppresseth the poor to increase his riches, and he that giveth to the rich, shall surely come to want.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Bow down thine ear and hear the words of the wise, and apply thine heart unto my knowledge.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For it is a pleasant thing if thou keep them within thee, that they may indeed be ready upon thy lips.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: That thy trust may be in the Lord, I have made it known to thee this day, even to thee!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Have I not written to thee excellent things of counsel and knowledge,
verses.speaker: Narrator
