verses.text: that I might make thee know the certainty of the words of truth, that thou mightest answer the words of truth to them that send unto thee?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Rob not the poor because he is poor, neither oppress the afflicted at the gate;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for the Lord will plead their cause, and despoil the soul of those that despoiled them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Make no friendship with an angry man, and with a furious man thou shalt not go,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: lest thou learn his ways and get a snare for thy soul.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Be not thou one of them that strike hands or of them that are sureties for debts;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: if thou hast nothing to pay, why should he take away thy bed from under thee?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Remove not the ancient landmark which thy fathers have set.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Seest thou a man diligent in his business? He shall stand before kings; he shall not stand before men of low estate.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When thou sittest to eat with a ruler, consider diligently what is before thee;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and put a knife to thy throat if thou be a man given to appetite.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Be not desirous of his dainties, for they are deceitful meat.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Labor not to be rich; cease from thine own wisdom.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Wilt thou set thine eyes upon that which is not? For riches certainly build themselves wings; they fly away as an eagle toward the heavens.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Eat thou not the bread of him that hath an evil eye, neither desire thou his dainty meats;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for as he thinketh in his heart, so is he. “Eat and drink,” saith he to thee, but his heart is not with thee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The morsel which thou hast eaten shalt thou vomit up, and lose thy sweet words.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Speak not to the ears of a fool, for he will despise the wisdom of thy words.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Remove not the old landmark, and enter not into the fields of the fatherless;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for their Redeemer is mighty; He shall plead their cause against thee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Apply thine heart unto instruction, and thine ears to the words of knowledge.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Withhold not correction from the child, for if thou beatest him with the rod, he shall not die.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thou shalt beat him with the rod, and shalt deliver his soul from hell.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: My son, if thine heart be wise, my heart shall rejoice, even mine;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: yea, my reins shall rejoice when thy lips speak right things.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Let not thine heart envy sinners, but be thou in fear of the Lord all the day long.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For surely there is a reward, and thine expectation shall not be cut off.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Hear thou, my son, and be wise, and guide thine heart in the way.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Be not among winebibbers, among riotous eaters of flesh;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for the drunkard and the glutton shall come to poverty, and drowsiness shall clothe a man with rags.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Hearken unto thy father that begot thee, and despise not thy mother when she is old.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Buy the truth and sell it not, also wisdom and instruction and understanding.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The father of the righteous shall greatly rejoice, and he that begetteth a wise child shall have joy in him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thy father and thy mother shall be glad, and she that bore thee shall rejoice.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: My son, give me thine heart, and let thine eyes observe my ways;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for a whore is a deep ditch, and a strange woman is a narrow pit.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: She also lieth in wait as for a prey, and increaseth the transgressors among men.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Who hath woe? Who hath sorrow? Who hath contentions? Who hath babbling? Who hath wounds without cause? Who hath redness of eyes?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They that tarry long at wine, they that go to seek mixed wine.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Look not thou upon the wine when it is red, when it giveth his color in the cup, when it moveth itself aright.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: At the last it biteth like a serpent and stingeth like an adder:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thine eyes shall behold strange women, and thine heart shall utter perverse things.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yea, thou shalt be as he that lieth down in the midst of the sea, or as he that lieth upon the top of a mast.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “They have struck me,” shalt thou say, “and I was not sick! They have beaten me, and I felt it not! When shall I awake? I will seek it yet again!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Be thou not envious of evil men, neither desire to be with them;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for their heart studieth destruction, and their lips talk of mischief.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Through wisdom a house is built, and by understanding it is established;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and by knowledge shall the chambers be filled with all precious and pleasant riches.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A wise man is strong; yea, a man of knowledge increaseth strength.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For by wise counsel thou shalt wage thy war, and in the multitude of counselors there is safety.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Wisdom is too high for a fool; he openeth not his mouth in the gate.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He that deviseth to do evil shall be called a wicked person.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The thinking of foolishness is sin, and the scorner is an abomination to men.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If thou faint in the day of adversity, thy strength is small.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If thou forbear to deliver them that are drawn unto death, and those that are ready to be slain—
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: if thou sayest, “Behold, we knew it not”—doth not He that pondereth the heart consider it? And He that keepeth thy soul, doth He not know it? And shall not He render to every man according to his works?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: My son, eat thou honey because it is good, and the honeycomb which is sweet to thy taste.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So shall the knowledge of wisdom be unto thy soul when thou hast found it; then there shall be a reward, and thy expectation shall not be cut off.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Lie not in wait, O wicked man, against the dwelling of the righteous; spoil not his resting place;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for a just man falleth seven times and riseth up again, but the wicked shall fall into trouble.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Rejoice not when thine enemy falleth, and let not thine heart be glad when he stumbleth,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: lest the Lord see it and it displease Him, and He turn away His wrath from him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Fret not thyself because of evil men, neither be thou envious of the wicked;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for there shall be no reward to the evil man; the candle of the wicked shall be put out.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: My son, fear thou the Lord and the king, and mingle not with them that are given to change;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for their calamity shall rise suddenly, and who knoweth the ruin of them both?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These sayings also belong to the wise: It is not good to have respect of persons in judgment.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He that saith unto the wicked, “Thou art righteous”: him shall the people curse; nations shall abhor him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But to them that rebuke him shall be delight, and a good blessing shall come upon them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Every man that answereth right words, giveth a kiss on the lips.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Prepare thy work outside, and make ready the field for thyself; and afterwards build thine house.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Be not a witness against thy neighbor without cause, and deceive not with thy lips.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Say not: “I will do so to him as he hath done to me; I will render to the man according to his work.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I went by the field of the slothful, and by the vineyard of the man void of understanding;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and lo, it was all grown over with thorns, and nettles had covered the face thereof, and the stone wall thereof was broken down.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then I saw and considered it well; I looked upon it, and received instruction:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yet a little sleep, a little slumber, a little folding of the hands to sleep—
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: so shall thy poverty come as one that wandereth, and thy want as an armed man.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These are also proverbs of Solomon, which the men of Hezekiah, king of Judah, copied out:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It is the glory of God to conceal a thing, but the honor of kings is to search out a matter.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As the heaven for height and the earth for depth, so the heart of kings is unsearchable.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Take away the dross from the silver, and there shall come forth a vessel for the refiner.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Take away the wicked from the presence of the king, and his throne shall be established in righteousness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Put not forth thyself in the presence of the king, and stand not in the place of great men;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for better it is that it be said unto thee, “Come up hither,” than that thou shouldest be put lower in the presence of the prince whom thine eyes have seen.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Go not forth hastily to contend, lest thou know not what to do in the end thereof when thy neighbor hath put thee to shame.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Debate thy cause with thy neighbor himself, and disclose not a secret to another,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: lest he that heareth it put thee to shame, and thine infamy turn not away.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A word fitly spoken is like apples of gold in settings of silver.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As an earring of gold and an ornament of fine gold, so is a wise reprover upon an obedient ear.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As the cold of snow at the time of harvest, so is a faithful messenger to them that send him, for he refresheth the soul of his masters.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Whoso boasteth himself of his gifts falsely is like clouds and wind without rain.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: By much forbearance is a prince persuaded, and a soft tongue breaketh the bone.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Hast thou found honey? Eat only so much as is sufficient for thee, lest thou be filled therewith and vomit it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Withdraw thy foot from thy neighbor’s house, lest he be weary of thee and so come to hate thee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A man that beareth false witness against his neighbor is a maul and a sword and a sharp arrow.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Confidence in an unfaithful man in time of trouble is like a broken tooth, and a foot out of joint.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As he that taketh away a garment in cold weather, and as vinegar upon soda, so is he that singeth songs to a heavy heart.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If thine enemy be hungry, give him bread to eat; and if he be thirsty, give him water to drink;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for thou shalt heap coals of fire upon his head, and the Lord shall reward thee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The north wind driveth away rain; so doth an angry countenance a backbiting tongue.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It is better to dwell in the corner of the housetop, than with a brawling woman in a large house.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As cold waters to a thirsty soul, so is good news from a far country.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A righteous man falling down before the wicked is as a troubled fountain and a corrupt spring.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It is not good to eat much honey; so also for men to search after their own glory is not glory.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He that hath no rule over his own spirit is like a city that is broken down and without walls.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As snow in summer and as rain in harvest, so honor is not seemly for a fool.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As the bird by wandering, as a swallow by flying, so a curse without cause shall not alight.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A whip for the horse, a bridle for the ass, and a rod for the fool’s back.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Answer not a fool according to his folly, lest thou also be like unto him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Answer a fool according to his folly, lest he think himself wise in his own conceit.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He that sendeth a message by the hand of a fool cutteth off the feet and drinketh violence.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The legs of the lame are not equal; so is a parable in the mouth of fools.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As he that bindeth a stone in a sling, so is he that giveth honor to a fool.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As a thorn pierceth into the hand of a drunkard, so is a parable in the mouth of fools.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The great God who formed all things both rewardeth the fool and rewardeth transgressors.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As a dog returneth to his vomit, so a fool returneth to his folly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Seest thou a man wise in his own conceit? There is more hope for a fool than for him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The slothful man saith, “There is a lion in the way; a lion is in the streets!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As the door turneth upon his hinges, so doth the slothful upon his bed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The slothful hideth his hand in his bosom; it grieveth him to bring it again to his mouth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sluggard is wiser in his own conceit than seven men that can render an answer.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He that passeth by and meddleth in strife belonging not to him, is like one that taketh a dog by the ears.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As a mad man who casteth firebrands, arrows and death,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: so is the man that deceiveth his neighbor and saith, “Am I not in jest?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Where no wood is, there the fire goeth out; so, where there is no talebearer, the strife ceaseth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As coals are to burning coals, and wood to fire, so is a contentious man to kindle strife.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The words of a talebearer are as wounds, and they go down into the innermost parts of the belly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Burning lips and a wicked heart are like a potsherd covered with silver dross.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He that hateth dissembleth with his lips and layeth up deceit within him;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: when he speaketh fair believe him not, for there are seven abominations in his heart.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Whose hatred is covered by deceit, his wickedness shall be shown before the whole congregation.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Whoso diggeth a pit shall fall therein, and he that rolleth a stone, it will return upon him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A lying tongue hateth those that are afflicted by it, and a flattering mouth worketh ruin.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Boast not thyself of tomorrow, for thou knowest not what a day may bring forth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Let another man praise thee, and not thine own mouth; a stranger, and not thine own lips.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A stone is heavy and the sand weighty, but a fool’s wrath is heavier than them both.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Wrath is cruel and anger is outraging, but who is able to stand before envy?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Open rebuke is better than secret love.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Faithful are the wounds from a friend, but the kisses of an enemy are deceitful.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The full soul loathes a honeycomb, but to the hungry soul every bitter thing is sweet.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As a bird that wandereth from her nest, so is a man who wandereth from his place.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Ointment and perfume make the heart rejoice; so doth the sweetness of a man’s friend by counsel from the heart.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thine own friend and thy father’s friend, forsake not; neither go to thy brother’s house in the day of thy calamity; for better is a neighbor that is near than a brother far off.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: My son, be wise and make my heart glad, that I may answer him that reproacheth me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A prudent man foreseeth the evil and hideth himself, but the simple pass on and are punished.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Take his garment that is surety for a stranger, but take a pledge from him for a strange woman.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He that, rising early in the morning, blesseth his friend with a loud voice: it shall be counted as a curse to him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A continual dripping on a very rainy day and a contentious woman are alike.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Whosoever would hide her would hide the wind, and the ointment of his right hand which betrayeth itself.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Iron sharpeneth iron; so a man sharpeneth the countenance of his friend.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Whoso keepeth the fig tree shall eat the fruit thereof; so he that waiteth on his master shall be honored.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As in water face answereth to face, so the heart of man to man.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Hell and destruction are never full; so the eyes of man are never satisfied.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As the refining pot for silver and the furnace for gold, so is a man tried by praise.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Though thou shouldest grind a fool in a mortar among wheat with a pestle, yet will not his foolishness depart from him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Be thou diligent to know the state of thy flocks, and look well to thy herds,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for riches are not for ever; and doth the crown endure to every generation?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The hay appeareth, and the tender grass showeth itself, and herbs of the mountains are gathered;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the lambs are for thy clothing, and the goats pay the price of the field;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and thou shalt have goats’ milk enough for thy food, for the food for thy household, and for the maintenance of thy maidens.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The wicked flee when no man pursueth, but the righteous are bold as a lion.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the transgression of a land, many are the princes thereof; but by a man of understanding and knowledge the state thereof shall be prolonged.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A poor man that oppresseth the poor is like a sweeping rain which leaveth no food.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They that forsake the law praise the wicked, but such as keep the law contend with them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Evil men understand not judgment, but they that seek the Lord understand all things.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Better is the poor that walketh in his uprightness than he that is perverse in his ways, though he be rich.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Whoso keepeth the law is a wise son, but he that is a companion of riotous men shameth his father.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He that by usury and unjust gain increaseth his substance, shall gather it for him that will pity the poor.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He that turneth away his ear from hearing the law, even his prayer shall be abomination.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Whoso causeth the righteous to go astray in an evil way shall himself fall into his own pit, but the upright shall possess good things.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The rich man is wise in his own conceit, but the poor man that hath understanding searcheth him out.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When righteous men rejoice, there is great glory; but when the wicked rise, men hide themselves.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He that covereth his sins shall not prosper, but whoso confesseth and forsaketh them shall have mercy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Happy is the man that feareth God always, but he that hardeneth his heart shall fall into evil.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As a roaring lion and a ranging bear, so is a wicked ruler over the poor people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The prince that lacketh understanding is also a great oppressor, but he that hateth covetousness shall prolong his days.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A man that doeth violence to the blood of any person shall flee to the pit; let no man stay him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Whoso walketh uprightly shall be saved, but he that is perverse in his ways shall fall at once!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He that tilleth his land shall have plenty of bread, but he that followeth after vain persons shall have poverty enough.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A faithful man shall abound with blessings, but he that maketh haste to be rich shall not be innocent.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: To have respect of persons is not good, for that man will transgress for a piece of bread.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He that hasteneth to be rich hath an evil eye and considereth not that poverty shall come upon him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He that rebuketh a man shall afterwards find more favor than he that flattereth with his tongue.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Whoso robbeth his father or his mother and saith, “It is no transgression,” the same is the companion of a destroyer.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He that is of a proud heart stirreth up strife, but he that putteth his trust in the Lord shall prosper.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He that trusteth in his own heart is a fool, but whoso walketh wisely, he shall be delivered.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He that giveth unto the poor shall not lack, but he that hideth his eyes shall have many a curse.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the wicked rise, men hide themselves; but when they perish, the righteous increase.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He that, being often reproved, stiffeneth his neck shall suddenly be destroyed, and that without remedy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the righteous are in authority, the people rejoice; but when the wicked rule, the people mourn.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Whoso loveth wisdom maketh his father rejoice, but he that keepeth company with harlots spendeth his substance.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The king by judgment establisheth the land, but he that receiveth bribes overthroweth it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A man that flattereth his neighbor spreadeth a net for his feet.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In the transgression of an evil man there is a snare, but the righteous doth sing and rejoice.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The righteous considereth the cause of the poor, but the wicked regardeth not to know it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Scornful men bring a city into a snare, but wise men turn away wrath.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If a wise man contendeth with a foolish man, whether he rage or laugh, there is no rest.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The bloodthirsty hate the upright, but the just seek his soul.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A fool uttereth all his mind, but a wise man keepeth it in until afterwards.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If a ruler hearken to lies, all his servants will be wicked.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The poor and the deceitful man meet together: the Lord lighteneth their eyes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The king that faithfully judgeth the poor, his throne shall be established for ever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The rod and reproof give wisdom, but a child left to himself bringeth his mother to shame.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the wicked are multiplied, transgression increaseth; but the righteous shall see their fall.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Correct thy son, and he shall give thee rest; yea, he shall give delight unto thy soul.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Where there is no vision, the people perish; but he that keepeth the law, happy is he.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A servant will not be corrected by words; for though he understand, he will not give heed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Seest thou a man that is hasty in his words? There is more hope for a fool than for him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He that delicately bringeth up his servant from childhood shall have him become his son in the end.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: An angry man stirreth up strife, and a furious man aboundeth in transgression.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A man’s pride shall bring him low, but honor shall uphold the humble in spirit.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Whoso is partner with a thief hateth his own soul; he heareth cursings, but revealeth it not.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The fear of man bringeth a snare, but whoso putteth his trust in the Lord shall be safe.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Many seek the ruler’s favor, but every man’s judgment cometh from the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: An unjust man is an abomination to the just, and he that is upright in the way is an abomination to the wicked.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The words of Agur the son of Jakeh, even the prophecy: the man spoke unto Ithiel, even unto Ithiel and Ucal:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Surely I am more brutish than any man, and have not the understanding of a man.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I neither learned wisdom, nor have the knowledge of the holy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Who hath ascended up into heaven or hath descended? Who hath gathered the wind in His fists? Who hath bound the waters in a garment? Who hath established all the ends of the earth? What is His name, and what is His Son’s name, if thou canst tell?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Every word of God is pure; He is a shield unto them that put their trust in Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Add thou not unto His words, lest He reprove thee and thou be found a liar.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Two things have I required of Thee; deny me them not before I die:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Remove far from me vanity and lies; give me neither poverty nor riches; feed me only food sufficient for me,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: lest I be full, and deny Thee, and say, “Who is the Lord?”— or lest I be poor and steal, and take the name of my God in vain.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Accuse not a servant unto his master, lest he curse thee and thou be found guilty.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There is a generation that curseth their father, and doth not bless their mother.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There is a generation that are pure in their own eyes, and yet is not washed from their filthiness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There is a generation — O how lofty are their eyes, and their eyelids are lifted up!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There is a generation whose teeth are as swords, and their jaw teeth as knives, to devour the poor from off the earth, and the needy from among men.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The horseleech hath two daughters, crying, “Give, give!” There are three things that are never satisfied, yea, four things that say not, “It is enough”:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the grave, the barren womb, the earth that is not filled with water, and the fire that saith not, “It is enough.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The eye that mocketh at his father and despiseth to obey his mother, the ravens of the valley shall pick it out, and the young eagles shall eat it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There are three things which are too wonderful for me, yea, four which I know not:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the way of an eagle in the air, the way of a serpent upon a rock, the way of a ship in the midst of the sea, and the way of a man with a maid.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Such is the way of an adulterous woman: she eateth, and wipeth her mouth, and saith, “I have done no wickedness.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For three things the earth is disquieted, and for four which it cannot bear:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for a servant when he reigneth, and a fool when he is filled with meat,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for an odious woman when she is married, and a handmaid who is heir to her mistress.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There are four things which are little upon the earth, but they are exceeding wise:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the ants are a people not strong, yet they prepare their meat in the summer;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the conies are but a feeble folk, yet they make their houses in the rocks;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the locusts have no king, yet they go forth, all of them in ranks;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the spider taketh hold with her hands, and is in kings’ palaces.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There are three things which go well, yea, four which are comely in their goings:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: a lion which is strongest among beasts, and turneth not away for any;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: a greyhound, a hegoat also, and a king against whom there is no rising up.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If thou hast done foolishly in exalting thyself, or if thou hast thought evil, lay thine hand upon thy mouth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Surely the churning of milk bringeth forth butter, and the wringing of the nose bringeth forth blood: so the stirring of wrath bringeth forth strife.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The words of King Lemuel, the prophecy that his mother taught him:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: What, my son? And what, the son of my womb? And what, the son of my vows?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Give not thy strength unto women, nor thy ways to that which destroyeth kings.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It is not for kings, O Lemuel — it is not for kings to drink wine, nor for princes strong drink,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: lest they drink and forget the law, and pervert the judgment of any of the afflicted.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Give strong drink unto him that is ready to perish, and wine unto those that be of heavy hearts.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Let them drink and forget their poverty, and remember their misery no more.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Open thy mouth for the dumb, in the cause of all such as are appointed to destruction.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Open thy mouth, judge righteously, and plead the cause of the poor and needy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Who can find a virtuous woman? For her price is far above rubies.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The heart of her husband doth safely trust in her, so that he shall have no need of spoil.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: She will do him good and not evil all the days of her life.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: She seeketh wool and flax, and worketh willingly with her hands.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: She is like the merchants’ ships; she bringeth her food from afar.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: She riseth also while it is yet night, and giveth meat to her household and a portion to her maidens.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: She considereth a field and buyeth it; with the fruit of her hands she planteth a vineyard.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: She girdeth her loins with strength, and strengtheneth her arms.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: She perceiveth that her merchandise is good; her candle goeth not out by night.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: She layeth her hands to the spindle, and her hands hold the distaff.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: She stretcheth out her hand to the poor; yea, she reacheth forth her hands to the needy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: She is not afraid of the snow for her household, for all her household are clothed with scarlet.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: She maketh herself coverings of tapestry; her clothing is silk and purple.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Her husband is known at the gates, when he sitteth among the elders of the land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: She maketh fine linen and selleth it, and delivereth girdles unto the merchant.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Strength and honor are her clothing, and she shall rejoice in time to come.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: She openeth her mouth with wisdom, and on her tongue is the law of kindness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: She looketh well to the ways of her household, and eateth not the bread of idleness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Her children arise up and call her blessed; her husband also, and he praiseth her:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Many daughters have done virtuously, but thou excellest them all.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Favor is deceitful, and beauty is vain; but a woman who feareth the Lord, she shall be praised!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Give her of the fruit of her hands, and let her own works praise her at the gates.
verses.speaker: Narrator
